intro: Berzelia abrotanoides, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is known for its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in some African cultures for various ailments.
